p: WNV transmission in Europe involves strains that belong to the South Europe/Kenyan and the Israeli/American clusters of lineage 1a, or to lineage 2 [15], [16]. Lineage 1 has been involved in most of recent WNV epidemics in the world. However, analysis of molecular determinants of virus virulence has mainly concerned North American isolates with a particular focus on NY99 strains [17], [18]. In contrast, few studies have been conducted to elucidate the virulence of WNV isolates from Europe/Middle East in common hosts such as horses and avian species [19].
